name: lumpishly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in an awkward and stupid way: Every now and then a character in the play lumpishly tells a bit of back story, but it's never clear how one thing leads to another. After dinner, he usually wanders lumpishly about his garden.
More examplesFewer examplesHis frequent, cheerful references to his past sounded lumpishly heavy.There is little great about the new show, and the music was conducted rather lumpishly.He looked at her sitting lumpishly behind the desk, her glasses reflecting the overhead light.
